Class SpecularLight

  • java.lang.Object

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Light

    public class SpecularLight
extends DirectionalLight
    specular light means the shining dot on polished surfaces
    Author:
    Tim Trense

        public SpecularLight(Universe uni,
                     Color c,
                     Vector3d dir)
        constructs a new shiny light
        Parameters:
        uni - the universe to compute shadows cause by other renderable than the current-to-illuminate on
        c - the color of this light
        dir - the direction of the virtual light-rays of this

        public Color illuminate(Illuminatable c)
        Description copied from interface: Light
        calculates the visible color for the given illuminatable;
        the visible color is the color of the pixels on the screen for the given renderable
        Specified by:

        Overrides:
        illuminate in class DirectionalLight
        Parameters:
        c - the illuminatable giving the data of its surface
        Returns:
        the visible color to draw the illuminatable in if no other light is used
